Body: ASME International Capitol Update January 4, 2002   1. Appropriation Bills Wrapped Up  --Energy and NASA FY2002 Appropriated Budgets Detailed  2. Math and Science Partnerships at Department of Education and NSF  --Agencies to Work Together to Strengthen Math and Science Education   3. GAO Begins New Investigation into Federal Office of Pipeline Safety  --Dingell Request to Investigate Resource and Personnel Needs at OPS  4. Bush Nominates Director for Department of Energy Office of Science  --Raymond Orbach, Chancellor at UC Riverside, is Named  *****************************  APPROPRIATION BILLS WRAPPED UP  When President Bush issued his proposed fiscal year 2002 budget to Congress last April, investment in research and development was not a top priority in most federal agencies.  Eight months and a major terrorist attack later, Congress and the President agreed to put aside their disagreements over funding levels for most federal programs until another day.    Here is a brief summary of how energy and space research programs fared in the recent appropriations cycle.  Information on funding for research programs at the National Science Foundation, the National Institute of Standards and Technology, and the Department of Defense will appear in Update next week.  Energy  Funding for energy research and development programs are divided between two appropriations bills - Energy & Water and Interior.  The Energy Committee of ASME's Council on Engineering submitted testimony last spring on the energy programs contained in both bills.  Copies of the testimony are available at:  http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-21.html and http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-22.html  The Interior bill provides funding for fossil energy and energy conservation R&D programs.  In its testimony to the House and Senate Appropriations Committees, the COE Energy Committee recommended several key areas that it believed merited increases above the President's request.   In all of those areas - carbon sequestration, advanced gas turbines, and fuel cell research - Congress ultimately supported the ASME Committee's recommendations.  For carbon sequestration, the President had requested $20.6 million, the ASME Committee had recommended $29.6 million, and Congress ultimately appropriated $32.1 million.  The President had proposed eliminating the advanced gas turbine program; the Committee had recommended that funding be restored to a level of $30 million, $1.1 million more than in FY 2001.  Congress decided on a level of $18.5 million.  For fuel cell research, the administration had proposed $45.1 million, a reduction of $7.2 million from the FY01 level.  The ASME Energy Committee had recommended $61.1 million, and Congress appropriated $58.1, which was higher than either the House or the Senate had recommended in their individual bills.  In the Energy & Water appropriations bill, renewable energy research funding was set at $396 million which, while $40 million less than the Senate bill, was $20 million above the House-passed number, $120 million above the President's request, and $21 million above current levels.  Nuclear Energy Research received $250.5 million, which is $27 million more than the President's request, but $9 million less than current levels.  The Nuclear Energy Research Initiative received $32 million, which is $19.2 million more than the President requested, $15 million more than the House version, but $6 million less than the Senate recommended and $3 million less than the ASME Energy Committee recommendation.  The Nuclear Energy Plant Optimization Program received $7 million, which is $2 million more than the President's request, the House bill, and current levels, but $2 million less than the Senate bill, and $3 million less than the Energy Committee recommended.  DOE science programs were funded at $3.2 billion, an increase of $73.2 million over the budget request and $52.7 million above fiscal year 2001.  High energy physics was funded at the request level of $716.1 million.  Nuclear physics also was funded at the request level of $360.5 million.  Biological and environmental research received $527.4 million, an increase of $84.4 million over the request. Funding for basic energy sciences was set at $1 billion, a decrease of $1 million from the request, although that total includes full funding for the Spallation Neutron Source.  The Advanced Scientific Computing Research Initiative was allocated $158 million, a decrease of $5 million from the request.  Finally, fusion energy research was funded at $248.5 million, the same as the request and the COE Energy Committee recommendation.  National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)  Funding for NASA's R&D programs is included in the VA-HUD and Independent Agencies appropriations bill.  National Science Foundation programs also are included in that bill.  ASME's Inter-Council Committee on Federal R&D has task forces that prepared testimony on both NASA's and NSF's budget requests.   Copies of the testimony can be found at:  http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-11.html and http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-23.html   Overall, NASA received $10.2 billion for its research programs, which is $343 million, or 3.5 percent, more than it received in FY01.  Of that amount, $1.72 billion is allocated for the International Space Station, which is a $440 million, or 15.2 percent reduction from last year.  Congress is increasingly concerned about cost overruns on the station, and has been highly critical of NASA's management of the project.  Among programs receiving substantial increases were Aero-Space Technology, which received a 12.4 percent ($275 million) increase, for a total of $2.49 billion; and Space Science, which received $2.84 billion, $224 million, or 8.5 percent, more than last year.   MATH AND SCIENCE PARTNERSHIPS AT DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND NSF  When President Bush announced his education plan last February, he proposed a Math and Science Partnership Initiative at the National Science Foundation, emphasizing a need for better science and mathematics education across the country.  Possible partners for the Math and Science Partnerships could include the State Education Agency, a math, science, or engineering department of an institution of higher education, a high need Local Education Agency, businesses, and nonprofit and for-profit groups of demonstrated effectiveness.  The House and Senate Education Committees, when drafting their education legislation, also thought the Math and Science Partnership program was needed, but placed the program at the Department of Education.  In the end, now that the authorization and appropriation process is complete, there are programs at both NSF and Department of Education.  The two agencies are in fact forming a task force to address the issue.    The FY 2002 Labor-HHS-Education appropriations conferees only appropriated $12.5 million for the newly-established Math and Science Partnerships at the Department of Education, which were authorized at $450 million in the recently approved Elementary and Secondary Education Authorization Act.  However, the FY 2002 VA/HUD appropriations bill, provided another $160 million for similar partnerships to be awarded by NSF.  In addition, the Labor-HHS-Education conferees encouraged states to continue making science and math instruction a high priority by also using other federal funds available for teacher improvement.  A total of $2.85 billion was appropriated for overall Teacher Quality.     For more information, please contact Patti Burgio at burgiop@asme.org.  GAO BEGINS NEW INVESTIGATION INTO FEDERAL OFFICE OF PIPELINE SAFETY  In response to a request by Representative John Dingell, ranking member of the House Energy and Commerce Committee, the General Accounting Office has begun another investigation into the Department of Transportation's Office of Pipeline Safety, specifically focusing on OPS's approach to preventing terrorist attacks like those of September 11, and whether the OPS has sufficient resources and personnel to deal with such events.  On October 3, GAO released an investigative report on OPS that said the agency had made progress, but still had the lowest rating of any transportation agency in implementing National Transportation Safety Board recommendations.  For more information, contact Francis Dietz at dietzf@asme.org.  BUSH NOMINATES ORBACH TO HEAD DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY OFFICE OF SCIENCE  President Bush has announced his intention to nominate Raymond Orbach to be Director of the Department of Energy's Office of Science.  The Chancellor of the University of California Riverside since 1992, Orbach served for ten years as Provost of UCLA's College of Letters and Science.   He has also served on numerous professional, scientific, and civic boards, as well as held visiting professorships at institutions in several countries, including Tel Aviv University, the Imperial College of Science and Technology in London, and the Ecole Superieure de Physique et Chimie Industrielle de la Ville De Paris.   DOE's Office of Science is responsible for the department's civilian research in high energy and nuclear physics, fusion energy sciences, basic energy sciences, biological and environmental research and computational science, and ten DOE civilian laboratories.  For more information, contact Francis Dietz at dietzf@asme.org.  ***************************** Melissa R. Murray Manager, State Government Relations ASME International 1828 L Street, NW, Suite 906 Washington, DC  20036 Phone:  202.785.7380 Fax:  202.429.9417 Email:  murraym@asme.org    -------------------------------- You are currently subscribed to ASME's capitol-news list as: rick.buy@enron.com To change your personal information, or email address please click on the link below: https://www.asmeny.org/memberaddr/html/security.htm  To unsubscribe send a blank email to leave-capitol-news-442645A@list.asme.org or click here: http://www.asmeny.org/cgi-bin1/WEB400CE?166082+ANT007+N+99999 --------------------------------
Subject: Capitol Update ASME International January 4, 2002

Body: Rick -   As we discussed, I have an outstanding tax liability with the Australian government, and I need your help in this matter.  Working for Enron Ex-Pat Services, I incurred additional tax liabilities which Enron was to pay on my behalf.  In simple terms, Enron agreed to make up the difference between my U.S. income tax liability and that charged by Australia.  My full U.S. tax liability was withheld from my paychecks and Enron was to make up the difference between this and the 48% charged by the Australian government.    As of today, the incremental tax liability has not been addressed by Enron, and I need to resolve this issue immediately.  It appears that the easiest solution is for Enron Corp. to wire Enron Australia the estimated tax liability, with Enron Australia passing the money to the Australian tax authority. I will have the final estimate from PWC first thing Monday morning, but it has been indicated that the liability in total will be less than $50,000 U.S..  I appreciate any help you can provide in getting this matter resolved.  I will provide you the specific estimates Monday morning, and in the interim, if there is anything else you need from me, I am at your disposal.   Thanks -   John Suttle
Subject: Australian Tax Liability

Body: Be happy to spend some time with them. Am around all weekend if need be. Rick   -----Original Message----- From:  Kitchen, Louise   Sent: Friday, January 04, 2002 9:42 AM To: Lavorato, John; Colwell, Wes; Port, David; Buy, Rick; Bradford, William S.; Beck, Sally; Hall, Bob M; Webb, Jay; Rub, Jenny Cc: Muller, Mark S.; Vann, Suzanne; Tycholiz, Barry Subject: The Euros  Today, the Euros are coming and John is going to be running this negotiation - here's the bad news they are not coming until 3:30pm today so we may have to work late.  Barry Tycholiz will be running this team. Barry - talk to Andy on form if you need help - you will also need to think about getting some traders available over week-end.  The Schedule outline is based on initial overview discussions/presentations  and then more detailed discussion can occur in individual groups the outline is as follows:  It may be better to split up earlier but I leave all those decisions to Andy.    4:00  Introduction   John Lavorato & Louise Kitchen 4:45  Financial Overview  Wes Colwell 5:15  Risk Overview   Buy / Port 5:45  Credit    Bradford 6:15  Back Office   Beck/Hall  6:45  Systems (EnronOnline)  Jay Webb  7:15             Mid/Back Office Systems Jay Webb    Infrastructure   Jenny Rub     Please make yourselves available - the meetings will take place in 2991  Tammie - please organize lunch and refreshments etc on John's card.  Tammie - please check availability.  Thanks for your continued understanding.  Louise
Subject: RE: The Euros

Body: Dear RICHARD:  Make a New Year's Resolution; help an ASME Student Member!  Recruit a new member and 50% of the First Year Dues will be spent on Scholarships.   ASME membership offers professional & personal development through:  * NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES * LATEST TECHNICAL INFORMATION * CAREER SERVICES  * CONTINUING EDUCATION INSTITUTE * Up to 20 % DISCOUNTS ON PUBLICATIONS * VALUE-ADDED PROGRAMS (Home & Auto Insurances, Career Fairs, Professional Liability Insurances, etc.) * AND MORE!  Here's how to participate: 1. Print your name and membership number on the Sponsor's Name line of the attached application. Make copies. 2. Discuss the benefits of joining ASME and distribute membership applications to your colleagues. 3. For additional applications call 800-THE-ASME (800-843-2763); outside North America call 973-882-1167 or access the downloadable application at: http://www.asme.org/pdf/member/expresapnmme01.pdf 4. Follow up with new members that you recruited to welcome them to ASME. Visit http://www.asme.org/membershipdrive/ for complete campaign details.    HAPPY NEW YEAR, Cheryl Hasan Coordinator, Member Recruitment     -------------------------------- You are currently subscribed to ASME's mgam list as: rick.buy@enron.com To change your personal information, or email address please click on the link below: https://www.asmeny.org/memberaddr/html/security.htm  To unsubscribe send a blank email to leave-mgam-870899L@list.asme.org --------------------------------
Subject: ASME Membership

Body: I'll attend in person. Tx Rick   -----Original Message----- From:  Fleming, Rosalee   Sent: Monday, January 07, 2002 7:06 AM To: Bowen Jr., Raymond; Buy, Rick; Causey, Richard; Delainey, David W.; Derrick Jr., James; Dietrich, Janet; Fallon, Jim; Haedicke, Mark E.; Horton, Stanley; Hughes, James A.; Koenig, Mark; Lay, Kenneth; McMahon, Jeffrey; Sherriff, John; Whalley, Greg Cc: Blackwood, Connie; Chapman, Kay; Elbertson, Janette; Ford, Sue; Harris, Stephanie J ; Heathman, Karen K.; Marshall, Lucy; Mendez, Yorleni; Schiller, Marsha; Stark, Cindy; Taylor, Liz; Valencia, Laura; Wells, Tori L.; Westbrook, Sharron Subject: Enron Management Committee Meeting, Monday, January 7, 2002 @ 11:00 a.m. Importance: High  Please let me know as soon as possible if you can attend this meeting in person or if you want to call-in.  I will provide the call-in number.  Thanks.  Rosie
Subject: RE: Enron Management Committee Meeting, Monday, January 7, 2002 @  11:00 a.m.

Body: <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0054/final/images/gradient.gif>   <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0054/final/images/header.gif>    In this edition of the e-newsletter from Handspring.com <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4518.233.34125625>...      Buy Visor Neo-get a free bi-fold leather case  Announcement-Handspring launches enterprise website  Software-organize your data into folders  Modules and Add-Ons-record messages and print labels fast  Write Stuff-"From a Visor Newbie"    Buy a Visor Neo, Get a Free Bi-Fold Leather Case Offer good for a limited time only     <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4519.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> Now when you buy the super fast Visor Neo handheld, you'll also get a FREE bi-fold leather case (a $29.99 value). With slots for cards, an extra stylus, a pen loop and a pad of paper, this handy case combines function and style. This fantastic offer is only good for a limited time though, so act fast! Check out Neo and our entire line of Visor handhelds <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4519.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Special Offers Visit our Special Offers page to get the latest scoop on all the incredible deals at Handspring.com. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4534.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Add Style to Your Visor Handheld Check out our cool accessories!    Whether your Visor handheld is brand new or a trusty old friend, be sure to check out all the accessories at Handspring.com.      Stylish Cases <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4520.233.34125625>-so many to choose from, to match your unique tastes  Great Add-Ons <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4520.233.34125625>-like the arcade-style GameFace and portable keyboards  Cradles, Cables, and Chargers <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4520.233.34125625>-to stay synchronized wherever you go   <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4520.233.34125625>   When you shop, make sure you're getting the right fit, and select accessories for your specific Visor handheld model. Learn more here <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4521.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Handspring Protection Plan Don't forget that Handspring has a selection of three extended warranty plans designed to protect your Visor handheld investment. Each plan includes 12 months of extended coverage beyond the manufacturer's warranty, at one low price with no deductibles or hidden charges. Find a plan that's right for you! <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4522.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Handspring Launches Enterprise Website A reference site for Handspring enterprise news    We're pleased to announce the launch of our new Enterprise website at Handspring.com. Visit this site today to find out how Handspring products and services are paving the way in the enterprise market. You'll also have access to enterprise related news-including press releases, partner programs, case studies, and more. Check it out now at http://www.handspring.com/enterprise <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4533.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Treo Talk In the past two months, we've told you a lot about our new product, the Handspring Treo? communicator. This week we thought you might like to read some of the amazing comments that others have made about Treo.    Fortune "The Treo is as important an addition to my daily life as any previous technology, including the Macintosh, the original PalmPilot, and the BlackBerry-and maybe even cars and planes!" (Stewart Alsop) Read the full review <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4523.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4523.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4524.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> MSNBC.com "Handspring isn't lying when they say that the Treo is a new category of portable device. They call the Treo a 'communicator.' You can call it a nearly perfect melding of a Palm OS PDA and a GSM cellular world phone." (Gary Krakow) Read the full review <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4524.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  BusinessWeek "Both a phone and a handheld, the new Treo 180 is a triumph of design and functionality that pushes all the right buttons." (Steve Wildstrom) Read the full review <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4525.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4525.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Software Make a resolution to get organized and have fun this year. These software titles are your first step towards getting there.     <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4526.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> FilePoint? 2.1 Add the familiarity of Windows Explorer to your Visor handheld  FilePoint brings folders to your Visor handheld, allowing you to organize your applications and documents in the same logical fashion that you use with your desktop. Whether you store your files on RAM or your Handspring Flash Module, you'll enjoy easy access to all of your data. Create, Open, File, Move, Print, Beam, or Delete your documents without ever accessing a hidden menu. Plus, save 15% when you order before January 31, 2002! Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4526.233.34125625>      <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Billiards 3.0 Rack 'em up!  You don't have to visit the local pool hall for a quick game of 8-ball. Just turn on your Visor handheld, stack 'em and rack 'em! Billiards has been upgraded with a whole bunch of new features, including improved drag-and-drop stroke technology and an improved user-friendly interface. Games include Pool 8-Ball (BCA), Pool 8-Ball (Bar), Pool 9-Ball and the Pyramid. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4527.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4527.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Want More Software? Check out Handspring.com's Software Section <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4528.233.34125625> for all kinds of great tools, games and more.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Modules and Add-Ons Roll in the New Year with these new modules and add-ons.  Admobis ProRecord Digitally record notes, memos and reminders     <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4529.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> The new ProRecord digital voice recorder lets you record messages right into your Address Book, To Do, Date Book and Memo Pad. It has 16 MB of onboard flash memory for 8.5 hours of recording, or up to 1024 individual messages. A built-in high-quality microphone and speaker allows easy recording and playback. Plus, you can even send your messages in email for that personal touch. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4529.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Pocket Chess Deluxe v.2.5 Now sale priced at only $19.99  Now you can get PocketChess Deluxe v2.5 Special Edition for only $19.99-that's 50% off the regular price. PocketChess is your on-the-go companion for good old-fashioned chess-playing fun. Your chess games will come alive with life-like wood grain, beautiful marble and other exclusive board styles and piece sets. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4530.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4530.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Dymo LabelWriter EL Turbo Save $100 on the fastest label printer     <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4531.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> For the fastest and easiest way to print labels from your Visor handheld, nothing beats the DYMO LabelWriter EL Turbo. And now you can get it for just $149 (after $100 instant rebate). What's more, its thermal print technology means you'll never spend a cent on inkjet cartridges or ribbons! Enjoy laser-sharp print on over 40 choices of labels-including address, shipping, file folder, disk, and many more. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4531.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Complete Module List For a complete, updated list of Handspring.com's Springboard modules, check out our Springboard Spotlight <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.4532.233.34125625> page.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Write Stuff We love to spotlight emails we get from seasoned users of Visor handhelds, but it's also great fun to hear from our newest customers like Angela P., who just got her Visor handheld over the holidays.  From a Visor Newbie This little doozy has to be the greatest invention of all time. I just wanted to send you an email and let you know how much I love it! I ordered it on-line before Thanksgiving and got it shortly thereafter.  It's amazing how much information you can have at your fingertips! Two things that I've done with it so far is added my vehicle info to my Memo pad (maintenance records / insurance info) to a category called CARS. (So the next time I take my car in for an oil change and they say, "When was the last time you replaced your air filter," I'll be like, "Well, funny that you ask because I've got that info right here." Love that!!  Also, I love the capability to have all of my health insurance info at my fingertips. I made a category on my Memo pad and included info like who my insurance is for dental, health, vision, plus my doctors names, numbers, etc... not to mention that I've got numbers, addresses, and email info for everyone. And that handy little calendar from Outlook that reminds me of stuff-all at my fingertips! I'm just learning about all the capabilities, but so far, I think IT'S FABULOUS! I'm telling everyone I know to get one!  Thanks again! Angela P.    Send Us Your Stories and Pictures  If you'd like to share a story of how you use your Visor handheld (at work, home or play!), send us an email at enews@handspring.com. If you have a question relating to customer support, try out our customer support link below.     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Tips and Tricks Stay tuned! In our next edition we'll highlight the most popular tips that have appeared in e-newsletters of the past four months-as voted by you, our readers.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0020/final/images/footerbar.gif>  Customer Support If you have any questions relating to Customer Support, please visit our Customer Support site <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.3201.233.34125625>.  International Subscribers Please note that all special offers presented in the e-newsletter apply to the US and Canada only. If you live in Europe and would like to subscribe to our European Handspring e-newsletter, please click here <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.3202.233.34125625>.  Online Privacy Policy We encourage you to visit our website if you'd like to learn about Handspring.com's online privacy policy <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2142.10556.39102.3203.233.34125625>.  To Unsubscribe If you no longer wish to receive additional Handspring e-newsletters, please click here <http://h.4at1.com/c/e/u/unsub.jsp?uid=141.2142.10556.233.1.34125625>. <http://h.4at1.com/c/e/u/unsub.jsp?uid=141.2142.10556.233.1.34125625>      <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/spacer.tif?sid=141.2142.10556.233.34125625>
Subject: Start the New Year off right with fabulous savings at  Handspring.com!

Body: <http://enews.spegcs.org/images/top_banner.gif>   SPE-GCS e-Newsletter January 7, 2002          Welcome to the Society of Petroleum Engineers - Gulf Coast Section electronic newsletter, provided as a service to SPE-GCS members. If you would like to be removed from this mailing list please reply <mailto:spegcswebmaster@schipul.com?subject=Remove> to this email with the word "REMOVE" in the subject line. Body: Dear, Richard  The January 2002 issue of your SPE eUpdate includes:  WHAT'S NEW * December winner announced in SPE's Share Our Strength contest * Register for your unique SPE e-mail account * Housing and registration information available for 2002 Offshore Technology Conference   RESCHEDULED MEETINGS IADC/SPE Middle East Drilling Technology Conference and Exhibition   FIND THE TECHNOLOGY  New technologies, case studies, best practices, and information exchange at: * Fourth International Symposium on Oilfield Scale * 2002 SPE/IADC Drilling Conference * Sixth International Conference on Health, Safety, and Environment in Oil and Gas Exploration and Production * 2002 SPE International Symposium and Exhibition on Formation Damage Control * 2002 SPE Forum Series in Asia Pacific (I and II)  Find "use-it-now" technology at SPE Applied Technology Workshops: * Gas Utilization and Disposal * Production Enhancement  * Off Well Site Decision Making * Geomechanics Applications for Reservoir Exploitation * Real-Time Wellbore Stability * E-Business in the Petroleum Industry * Field Management of Mature Reservoirs   AUTHOR OPPORTUNITIES Want to author a paper for presentation at an SPE meeting? Here are upcoming opportunities.   SPE CALENDAR A list of coming Society events.  xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx WHAT'S NEW  David Rice of the Dallas Section is the December 2001 quarterly winner in SPE's Share Our Strength membership recruitment campaign contest. SPE members become eligible for monthly drawings when they recruit qualified new SPE members. Learn more about the campaign at http://www.spe.org/membership/  SPE e-mail is perfect for professionals who are constantly on the go. Accessible from any Web browser, your private, secure, and commercial-free SPE e-mail account allows you to check your e-mail from any place at any time. To register, visit the MySPE! section of SPE.org at http://www.spe.org/spelogin2.fcc?TYPE=33554433&REALMOID=06-3bd08167-9c38-0058-0000-3f3a00003f3a&GUID=&SMAUTHREASON=0&TARGET=http://www.spe.org:81/spe/cda/views/siteminder/authenticate/0,1587,1648_2394,00.html  Reserve your hotel room now for the 2002 Offshore Technology Conference, 6-9 May at the new Reliant Center at Reliant Park in Houston. View the conference schedule and technical program, as well as information about Topical Luncheons, General Sessions, and the Exhibition. http://speonline.spe.org/htmlevents/2002otc/conference.html   RESCHEDULED MEETINGS The IADC/SPE Middle East Drilling Technology Conference and Exhibition has been rescheduled for 9-11 March in Bahrain.   FIND THE TECHNOLOGY The Fourth International Symposium on Oilfield Scale, 30-31 January, Aberdeen, offers focused technical presentations related to the research and application of mineral scale control. The two-day event covers case histories, challenging environments, scale inhibition challenges, emerging technologies, and the economics of scale management. Registration is available through 22 January. For more information and to register, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_22035,00.html.  Conference registration and housing forms for the 2002 IADC/SPE Drilling Conference, 26-28 February, Dallas, are available online. Also, see who'll be exhibiting and what technology will be discussed at http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_24789,00.html  "Partnership for a Sustainable Future" is the theme of the Sixth SPE International Conference on Health, Safety, and Environment in Oil and Gas Exploration and Production, 20-22 March, Kuala Lumpur. Planned are three plenary sessions, 14 panel sessions, 44 technical sessions, and one poster session. For more information and to register, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_24800,00.html  As the largest and most diversified conference related to preventing, diagnosing, and remediating formation damage, the 2002 SPE International Symposium and Exhibition on Formation Damage Control, 20-21 February, Lafayette, Louisiana, U.S.A., will offer sessions designed to bridge the tasks expected of reservoir, drilling, production, and geological professionals. Find out more at http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_22089,00.html  SPE Forum Series in Asia Pacific (Nusa Dua, Indonesia) Forum I, The Continuing Role of Well Testing, 12-17 May. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_24723,00.html Forum II, Delivering the 40,000 ft ERD Well, 19-24 May http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_24889,00.html   Find "use-it-now" technology in your technical interests or specialties at any of the following SPE Applied Technology Workshops: * Gas Utilization and Disposal, 7-10 April, Phuket, Thailand, aims to facilitate sharing experiences and recent technological advances for maximizing the efficiency with which "gas" can be exploited and reducing negative environmental and economic impacts. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_24792,00.html * Production Enhancement, 21-24 April, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia, will focus on incrementally increasing production based upon case histories and working examples that include application of new and existing technology, automation-artificial intelligence, cost reduction, business partnerships, and statistical-analytical methods. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_286329,00.html * Case studies will be the focus of Off Well Site Decision Making, 22-23 April, Austin, Texas, U.S.A. Issues to be explored include offsite optimization of drilling operations - what works and what doesn't; integration of drilling and G&G information; offsite monitoring and management of major rig equipment; offsite optimization of non-drilling operations, such as completions stimulation; offsite decision making as a way to leverage and share knowledge; and psychological and cultural issues involved in transferring part of rig decision making activity off site. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_270287,00.html * Geomechanics Applications for Reservoir Exploitation, 28 April - 1 May, Kota Kinabalu, Sabah, Malaysia, is targeted to develop and enhance the understanding of each professional's role in the overall management of geomechanics in today's operating environment.  http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_286058,00.html * Drilling, geological, petrophysical, and geomechanics engineers involved in petroleum well construction can benefit from Real Time Wellbore Stability, 20-21 May, Houston. Presenters will address limitations of current technology and future developments. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2236_270517,00.html * E-Business in the Petroleum Industry, 2-5 June, Singapore, will focus in discussing the various applications of e-business for the industry, the implications in work processes and change management, obstacles and potential benefits for operators and service companies, current practices, developments, and future trends. http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_315201,00.html * Post plateau and decline period in a field's life cycle curve is the focus of the third workshop on Field Management of Mature Reservoirs, 4-7 June, Scheveningen, The Netherlands. Discussions include technical challenges, best practices, case histories, risk management, and people management. Deadline for receipt of applications is 15 March 2002. For the workshop brochure and/or to submit an application please visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_341720,00.html   AUTHOR OPPORTUNITIES Want to author a paper for presentation at an SPE meeting? Here are upcoming opportunities:  * "Value Creation Through Appropriate Technology: Transforming Opportunities into Realities" is the theme of the IADC/SPE Asia Pacific Drilling Technology Conference, 9-11 September, Jakarta, Indonesia.. To explore possible paper proposal categories or to submit a paper proposal, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_25144,00.html  * "Technology for Tomorrow's Reservoirs" is the theme for 2002 Europec, 23-25 October, Aberdeen. Areas of interest sought include deep water, individual technologies, subsea, construction, economic value of data, production optimization, risk management, well/reservoir modeling, and increasing recovery factors. View guidelines and the submission form at http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_108046,00.html. * "Creative Solutions for Maturing Basins and New Frontiers" is the theme of the SPE Asia Pacific Oil & Gas Conference and Exhibition, 8-10 October, Melbourne, Australia. Seeking paper proposals on gas technology, business uncertainty and risk, well construction, knowledge management, EOR, facilities optimization, management of maturing fields, reservoir characterization, case studies and other categories.  To see all of the categories and submit a paper proposal, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/eventMaster/0,1470,1648_2194_25172,00.html.   Are you an expert in your field? SPE's technical journals, the "Definitive Technical Series," seek technical editors to contribute their expertise to SPE Journal, SPE Drilling & Completion, SPE Production & Facilities, or SPE Reservoir Evaluation & Engineering. Apply online at http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/shared/viewHtmlMaster/0,1565,1648_2312_8866,00.html   SPE CALENDAR For a list of upcoming Society events, visit http://www.spe.org/spe/cda/views/events/channelMaster/0,1468,1648_2194,00.html   xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx www.spe.org The Society of Petroleum Engineers Inc. (SPE) is pleased to send you this issue of the SPE eUpdate, a monthly bulletin that provides the latest information and directly links you to more details on Society meetings, membership, and products and services, as well as SPE Online and other news of interest xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx HOW TO UNSUBSCRIBE xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx The SPE eUpdate is a service to SPE members and friends. If you have suggestions or comments, please send them to service@spe.org. If you do not wish to receive this newsletter in the future, send a message to service@spe.org, with "SPE eUpdate" in the subject line and the phrase "unsubscribe newsletter" in the text. Please include your member name or your member number.  The Society of Petroleum Engineers P.O. Box 833836 Richardson, TX 75083-3836 U.S.A. 972-952-9393 service@spe.org www.spe.org  If you have received the SPE eUpdate in error, please accept our apology.           0766576
Subject: January 2002 SPE eUpdate

Body: This is a message from The Risk Waters Group     Dear Mr Rick Buy,     WeatherRisk 2002 - Risk & Energy & Power Risk Management magazine's annual weather risk measurement and management congress  New York, 23 & 24 January 2002 - That's only two weeks away!  http://www.risk-conferences.com/weather2002?caller=em <http://pull.xmr3.com/p/79-5A88/29209837/http-www.risk-conferences.com-weather2002-cclickto1.html>     The comprehensive agenda will delve deeply into the issues facing weather risk professionals and the choices confronting end-users of weather risk tools today, split into two intensively research streams encompassing: Buying and trading weather products, Investing in the weather market, Practical application of weather risk tools, Pricing and structuring weather products.     This truly global event will offer senior representatives from the weather risk industry an ideal opportunity for networking and discussion, WeatherRisk 2002 will provide an unrivalled platform to examine the current market drivers; future possibilities and what must be done to overcome present obstacles to growth.     Hear from leading practitioners including:     New products in the weather risk management industry   Gary Taylor, INDEPENDENT SPECIALIST (FORMERLY ENRON)  How banks can exploit their abilities to aid development of the weather market  Gilbert Lavoie, SOCIETE GENERALE  Peter A. Nikitaidis, SOCIETE GENERALE  Utilising weather securitisation to offset risk   Dr Harvey Stern, BUREAU OF METEOROLGY, AUSTRALIA     For the full updated programme please visit the conference website:  http://www.risk-conferences.com/weather2002?caller=em <http://pull.xmr3.com/p/79-5A88/29209840/http-www.risk-conferences.com-weather2002-cclickto2.html>     NOTE: Corporate end-users will be offered a 50% discount off the standard delegate fee     I look forward to meeting you.     Yours sincerely     Frances Tully  Divisional Manager, Conferences     If you know of any colleagues who may also be interested in this event, please forward this e-mail to them.   Many thanks.     WeatherRisk 2002 - Risk & Energy & Power Risk Management magazine's annual weather risk measurement and management congress  New York, 23 & 24 January 2002  For the full updated programme please visit the conference website:  http://www.risk-conferences.com/weather2002?caller=em <http://pull.xmr3.com/p/79-5A88/29209842/http-www.risk-conferences.com-weather2002-cclickto3.html>     Just some of the organisation that will be attending WeatherRisk 2002:     AGF Insurance, Agroasemex, AON Capital Markets Inc, Applied Insurance Research Inc, Banco De Mexico, Bureau of Meteorology, Caminus, Corney & Barrow, Deutsche Bundesbank, e-Acumen, Element Re, Entergy-Koch Trading LP, Euronext, Futurisk, Heating Oil Partners, Hess Energy Trading Company, Hess Trading Company, Hydro Quebec, IFC, Intelligent Financial Systems Limited, IntesaBci, Key Corp, Lehman Brothers, LIFFE, Longitude Inc, Morgan Lewis & Bockius LLP, MVV Energie AG, Noesis Inc, Risk Management Solutions, Shin Nihon & Co, Southern Hydro Partnership, Standard & Poors, Swiss Reinsurance America, Tennessee Valley Authority, The Pennsylvania State University, TXU Energy Trading, University of Kentucky, University of Pennsylvania, Warren Whitney & Sherwood, Weather Ventures Ltd, Weather Wise, Willis Sturctured Financial Solutions Limited, World Bank, WxPx, XL America, Zipspeed    Risk Waters Group  28-29 Haymarket  London, UK  SW1Y 4RX  Tel: 00 44 (0)20 7484 9700  Mailto: listadmin@riskwaters.com     --------------------------------------------------------------------- If you would prefer not to receive further messages from this sender: 1. Click on the Reply button. 2. Replace the Subject field with the word REMOVE. 3. Click the Send button. You will receive one additional e-mail message confirming your removal.

Body: ASME International Capitol Update January 10, 2002   1. Town Hall Meeting to be Held with Representative Holt -Sponsored by ASME and AIChE  2. Daschle Endorses Doubling of Civilian R&D -Also Cites Need for Balance in Federal R&D Portfolio   3. State of Technology in Maryland to be Held in Annapolis  -Focus on Technology-Based Entrepreneurship  4. OMB Report Targets List of Agency Regulations -List Includes EPA and DOE Regulations   5. A Day at the Capitol to be Held in California -Agenda Will Focus on Energy, Transportation, and Engineering Licensing   6. DOT Proposes Rule To Reduce Effects Of Natural Gas Pipeline Accidents -Agency's Goal to Protect Highly Populated Areas  7. Appropriations Wrap Up Continued -NSF, NIST, and DOD FY2002 Budgets Summarized  *****************************   TOWN HALL MEETING TO BE HELD WITH REPRESENTATIVE HOLT  ASME, in conjunction with AIChE, will host a Science, Engineering, and Technology Town Hall meeting with Congressman Rush Holt (D-NJ) on Tuesday, January 22, 2002, at the Ramada Inn in East Brunswick.  This forum will provide an opportunity to discuss with a member of Congress current public policy issues involving science, engineering, and technology.  Registration deadline is January 16, 2002.  Contact Patti Snyder at snyderp@asme.org for program and registration details.   DASCHLE ENDORSES DOUBLING OF CIVILIAN R&D  Senate Majority Leader Tom Daschle called for doubling of civilian R&D funding and making the R&D tax credit permanent in a speech on the economy Friday.  Calling for a "balanced research portfolio," he noted that the National Institutes of Health "should not be the sole objective of U.S. science and technology policy."  His speech can be found at http://democrats.senate.gov/%7Edpc/releases/2002-1-4a.html For more information, contact Melissa Murray at murraym@asme.org.     STATE OF TECHNOLOGY IN MARYLAND TO BE HELD IN ANNAPOLIS  ASME will join with the Technology Council of Maryland in co-sponsoring an annual gathering of Maryland lawmakers and industry leaders to discuss technology-based economic development.  This year's program will feature technology-based entrepreneurship.  Hear about challenges, accomplishments and opportunities from successful Maryland technology start-ups as well as examine how schools and universities are preparing future engineering, science and technology entrepreneurs.   The summit will be held in Annapolis on February 4.  For program and registration details, go to http://www.asme.org/gric/ If you have additional questions, please contact Reese Meisinger at meisingerr@asme.org.   OMB REPORT TARGETS LIST OF AGENCY REGULATIONS The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) recently published a report that lists federal regulations (including several environmental regulations like the new source review regulations under the Clean Air Act) it believes should be reviewed for possible changes.  The report also compares the cost and benefit of complying with health, safety, and environmental regulations, and proposals to improve the regulatory process. For more information, please contact Kathryn Holmes at holmesk@asme.org.    A DAY AT THE CAPITOL TO BE HELD IN CALIFORNIA  ASME's Region IX will host the 5th Annual Day at the Capitol in Sacramento, California on February 5.   The program will focus on three issues: energy, transportation, and engineering licensing.  Visits will also be scheduled for the participants with Chairman and Ranking Members of the appropriate committees of jurisdiction, as well as some individual visits with Assemblymen and Senators.    For program and registration details, go to http://www.asme.org/gric Additional information is available from Melissa Murray at murraym@asme.org.   DOT PROPOSES RULE TO REDUCE EFFECTS OF NATURAL GAS PIPELINE ACCIDENTS  On January 9 The Department of Transportation published the first portion of a proposed rule aimed at reducing the harmful effects of natural gas pipeline accidents.   DOT's Research and Special Programs Administration (RSPA), published a note in the Federal Register, to define areas of high consequence where significant or considerable human or property harm would result from a gas transmission pipeline accident.  The proposal is addressing integrity management programs for natural gas pipelines with a two-part rule.  The majority of the rule should be published sometime later this year. Integrity management refers to the periodic inspection, testing, and repair of all pipeline segments that could affect high consequence areas.   RSPA's philosophy toward gas pipelines builds on current class location regulations that require the operator to know what people would be affected by a pipeline rupture.  The agency's primary goal is to protect highly populated areas from a gas release.  Public comment on the proposed rule will be accepted until March 11, 2002.  For information, contact Francis Dietz at dietzf@asme.org.   APPROPRIATIONS WRAP UP CONTINUED  Last week, R&D funding at the Department of Energy and NASA were detailed.  This month, the highlights of the FY2002 National Science Foundation (NSF), the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), and the Department of Defense (DOD) budgets are summarized.   National Science Foundation  The NSF Task Force, of ASME's Inter-Council Committee on Federal Research and Development, provided testimony to the appropriate House and Senate Appropriations Subcommittees.  The testimony can be found at: http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-23.html In addition, ASME joined 80 engineering, scientific and professional societies; corporations; and universities in asking Congress for a 15 percent increase in the NSF budget for FY 2002, which would continue the momentum toward doubling the agency's budget by 2006.    In the end, Congress increased NSF's budget 8.4 percent ($373 million) to $4.8 billion, still significantly more than the 1.3 percent that had been requested by the Administration.  Of the total budget,  $3.6 billion will be allocated to the Research and Related Activities (RRA) budget line, an increase of 7.6 percent, or $256 million.  Within the RRA budget, engineering programs will receive $468 million (8.5 percent), a significant boost over the President's request of $431 million.   Department of Defense (DOD)   For the second year in a row, the DOD Task Force, of ASME's Inter-Council Committee on Federal R&D, delivered oral testimony before the House and Senate Defense Appropriations Subcommittees.  Copies of the testimony can be found at: http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-16.html  Basic Research and Applied Research, which provide a significant share of federal support for several key science and engineering disciplines, both received significant increases in funding.  Basic Research increased 5.5 percent to $1.389 billion, while Applied Research increased 12.5 percent ($459 million) to $4.135 billion.  The Advanced Technology Development line of the budget increased 11.4 percent ($457 million), for a total of $4.456 billion.   National Institute of Standards and Technology  The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Task Force, of ASME's Inter-Council Committee on Federal R&D, provided written testimony on the Fiscal Year (FY) 2002 appropriation to the appropriate House and Senate Appropriation Subcommittees.  Copies of the testimony can be found at: http://www.asme.org/gric/ps/2001/01-10.html   The Advanced Technology program, which provides matching grants to corporations to fund high-risk research, was increased 26.9 percent ($39.1 million), for a total of $184.5 million in new funds.  Combined with carryover funds from last fiscal year, the program will have $217.6 million in fiscal year 2002.  While the administration had attempted to suspend the ATP program unsuccessfully, it requested a significant increase (11.3 percent) for the Scientific and Technical Research and Services (STRS) budget, which funds the NIST in-house laboratories and the Baldridge National Quality program.  In the final bill, Congress provided only a 2.9 percent ($9.2 million) increase for this budget, for a total of $321.1 million.   ***************************** Melissa R. Murray Government Relations ASME International 1828 L Street, NW, Suite 906 Washington, DC  20036 Phone:  202.785.7380 Fax:  202.429.9417 Email:  murraym@asme.org    -------------------------------- You are currently subscribed to ASME's capitol-news list as: rick.buy@enron.com To change your personal information, or email address please click on the link below: https://www.asmeny.org/memberaddr/html/security.htm  To unsubscribe send a blank email to leave-capitol-news-442645A@list.asme.org or click here: http://www.asmeny.org/cgi-bin1/WEB400CE?166082+ANT007+N+99999 --------------------------------
Subject: Capitol Update ASME International January 10, 2002

Body: PVRC'S WORKSHOP ON TIGHTNESS-BASED BOLTED FLANGE  GASKET CONSTANTS AND DESIGN RULES  February 6 & 7, 2002, Safety Harbor Florida   REGISTER NOW AND WATCH FOR FUTURE ANNOUNCEMENTS ON PVRC'S WEBSITE AT WWW.FORENGINEERS.ORG  Description  You must attend this workshop to help keep your job knowledge useful by understanding the new design rules for bolted flanged joints! Are you ready for the New Tightness-Based Gasket constants and flange design changes that are about to replace the traditional constants and rules?  This workshop will get you ready with focus on three critical areas that apply to both ASME Section VIII flanges and standard B16 Joints.  The New Tightness-Based Rules Gasket Qualification and Selection Latest On Analysis and Assembly of Bolted Joints  This Two-Day Workshop is a "must" for those needing  advance information and know-how about applying the recently developed gasket constants and flange design rules. The tightness-based rules accommodate levels of permissible joint leakage, representing a new basis for design criteria and opening additional choices and decisions for users and designers.    Attendees will gain detailed knowledge about several topics focussing on the new gasket constants and design rules and particularly on issues relating to leakage criteria and associated choices.  The tightness concept is also extended to elevated temperature gasket qualification and selection, and know-how for efficient joint assembly and making zero leakage plant operation a realistic goal is presented.  Several industry experts will lead workshop sessions including: Bob Mikitka, Jim Payne, Michel Derenne, Yves Birembaut, Ron winter, Jerry Waterland, Rod Mueller, Anita Bausman, Jim Frew Hildegarde Zeres, Warren Brown, Ed Hayman, Bill Koves, and David Reeves. Attendees will receive a bound collection of the presentations and guidelines and recommendations.   For additional information contact Welding Research  Council at 212-591-7956 or www.forengineers.org/pvrc -- Register Now -- (SEE NEXT PAGE)  Day 1 - Wednesday, February 6, 2002  Pick up Workshop Materials at 7:30 A.M.  A.M. SESSION 1 -  8:30 am  ? Opening, Introduction and Overview ? Tightness-Based Rules -- Why and How ? Derivation of New Constants & ROTT Test  ? New European Calculation EN-1591 ? Comparison of New and Traditional Rules including B16 Flanges and the New Rules ? Elevated Temperature Gasket Tests  P.M. SESSION 2 - 1:00 PM  ? Elevated Temperature Gasket Tests (continued) ? CEN Tests Supporting EN-1591 ? Gasket Selection Considerations ? Test Protocol Guidelines for Gaskets ? Graphite Gasket Qualification ? PTFE Gasket Qualification ? Gasket Specification Considerations ? The ASTM & Process Plant Gaskets  NETWORKING TIME - RECEPTION -- 5:30 - 7:00  Day 2 - Thursday, February 7, 2002  AM SESSION 3 -    ? Finite Element Analysis Guidelines ? External Loads on Joints ? Thermal Loading in joints ? Spiral Wound Gasket Buckling ? Bolted Joint Assembly  P. M. SESSION 4  ? Zero-Leakage Operations of HX in a Large Refinery ? Gasket Selection and Considerations for a Large Chemical Complex ? PANEL: Future Trends and Current Needs ? Closure and Adjourn    Workshop REGISTRATION FORM   New Tightness-Based Bolted Flange  Gasket Constants and Design Rules  February 6 & 7,  2002 Safety Harbor Resort & Spa Safety Harbor, Florida, on Tampa Bay 105 N. Bayshore Drive  www.safetyharborspa.com Hotel Reservations: Phone: 727-726-1161 Fax: 727-726-4268   Registration Fee: May be applied to first year of $1250 WRC/PVRC Membership  Check one and take the discount if appropriate:  ____$415 for members/sponsors  ** ____$550 After January 4, 2002  ** Call 212-591-7956 if needed to determine qualification for this price. Body: Been following the Enron story as everyone else.  I am sure that is another side to it.  Hope things are going OK for you.  Lets catch up when things calm down.  Regards, James
Subject: How are you?

Body: It has been unreal. Would like to catch up. I may need a job! Looks like UBS has bought our trading operation which includes me for the moment anyway. Hope all is well on your end. Rick  -----Original Message-----  From: James Lam [mailto:jameslam@mediaone.net]  Sent: Sat 1/12/2002 10:50 PM  To: Buy, Rick  Cc:  Subject: How are you?    Been following the Enron story as everyone else.  I am sure that is another  side to it.  Hope things are going OK for you.  Lets catch up when things  calm down.   Regards,  James
Subject: RE: How are you?

Body: Rick --  Our baby, Addison Sterling, was born on Saturday, January 12th at 12:31 PM.  She was fairly big - 8 lbs 14 ozs and she is 20 inches long.  I've attached a link to the hospital's website that has her picture (she is much cuter in person, of course :)  We named her after Addison St which runs by Wrigley Field (Home of the Chicago Cubs) and the Pound Sterling.  Cami is doing well and we have returned home on Sunday night.  http://web.mhhs.org/nursery/babyDetails.asp?hospitalID=7&search=list&babyID=19650  RZ
Subject: Addison Sterling

Body: Congrats!!!! Rick  -----Original Message----- From: Rzipter@aol.com [mailto:Rzipter@aol.com] Sent: Monday, January 14, 2002 10:26 AM To: Buy, Rick Subject: Addison Sterling   Rick --  Our baby, Addison Sterling, was born on Saturday, January 12th at 12:31 PM.  She was fairly big - 8 lbs 14 ozs and she is 20 inches long. Parafone is the first cordless telephone module developed to work seamlessly with a handheld computer. It literally transforms your Visor handheld into fully functional 900 MHz cordless phone. Call anyone in your Address Book by simply tapping the right phone number. Parafone is the easy way to stay in touch and keep organized-at the same time. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4683.233.34125625>      <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Complete Module List For a complete, updated list of Handspring.com's Springboard modules, check out our Springboard Spotlight page <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4684.233.34125625>.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Software You won't know where the time went once you start playing these games.     <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4685.233.34125625>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif> Bejeweled 1.42 You can't play this gem just once  Perhaps the most addictive game ever made for the Visor handheld, Bejeweled is sure to entertain you for hours on end. The rules are easy, but don't let its simplicity fool you-it only takes one try before it gets you under its spell. Shuffle the jewels to get three or more of a kind in a row-then watch them disappear. Keep on going, but don't let the timer run out. Bet you can't play it just once. Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4685.233.34125625>      <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  PopCap Games Pack 1.2 The hottest games can now be yours  PopCap Games are sweeping the web, and now Astraware brings the top games to your Visor handheld. Swap gems to make lines in the fiendishly addictive Bejeweled. Outwit the mummy in Mummy Maze. Navigate your galleon through hazardous waters in Seven Seas. Become the mythical Alchemical Grand Master in Alchemy. Make molecules in Dr. Atomicus' Laboratory in Atomica! And all of this fun can be yours for just $29.95! Check it out <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4686.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4686.233.34125625>     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Want More Software? Check out Handspring.com's Software Section <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4687.233.34125625> for all kinds of great tools, games and more.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Tips & Tricks Every quarter we like to re-publish popular tips and tricks, as voted upon by you. Here are the top three tips from last autumn's e-newsletters-back by popular demand!     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0082/final/images/number3.gif>Drag and Drop Memos    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   Memo Pad automatically numbers your memos, but you can also manually change the order in which the memos appear by dragging and dropping them. Simply hold down the stylus on the memo, and drag it to where you want it to go!     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0082/final/images/number2.gif>Beaming Your Business Card    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   When you beam your business card, any attached note will be beamed along with it. Have a resume or a favorite quotation (up to 4,096 characters) that you'd like to share with others? Simply attach it as a note to your business card.     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0082/final/images/number1.gif>Floating Events    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   Floating events in Date Book Plus let you set appointments that "float" with you through the calendar, appearing each day until you've finally completed the task or event. Use floating events anytime you have a task or appointment that isn't necessarily fixed to a certain date. Like picking up dry cleaning-it may be ready on Monday, but who knows when you'll actually have time to pick it up? In Day View, just tap New, then tap Floating Event from the popup menu, and enter the name of the event. Your new floating event will appear as a circle on your Day View until you delete it.   <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  Write Stuff Many of us keep in touch with the office when we're "on the road", but e-newsletter subscriber Cynthia takes it to a whole new level!  Biking Cross-Country with My Visor Handheld I'm a partner for a graphic design firm. Taking three months off to bicycle from Washington, DC, to Florence, Oregon, would put a strain on the company. But my partner and our staff had given me their "you go, girl" blessing. They even built a special section of our corporate web site to highlight the trip: (http://www.gravesfowler.com/noteworthy/beyond.html <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.4688.233.34125625>). The plan was to post our journal as we moved across the country. It was a beautiful design; now the pressure was on for me to do the writing and get it back to them.  That's where my Visor came in. With a collapsible keyboard and modem module, we had a lightweight package of technology that would fit into my bag and keep us connected. We also carried a backup module to insure we wouldn't lose data when batteries ran low and we were miles from a store. I learned to set up my traveling office on picnic tables, in our tent, on diner tables surrounded by pancakes and eggs, in country churches and steamy laundromats. We stayed in a motel once a week and hooked up the modem to send the week's entries back home.    We also collected email messages from folks who were following our progress. As the weeks and miles added up, we realized through this connection how many people were rooting for us and following our unfolding story.    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>   <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0082/final/images/011502biking.jpg>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>  We feel lucky to have lived out a long time dream. Now in the middle of winter, I sometimes open my Visor, click back to a random summer day and savor the memories.  Send Us Your Stories and Pictures  If you'd like to share a story of how you use your Visor handheld (at work, home or play!), send us an email at enews@handspring.com. If you have a question relating to customer support, try out our customer support link below.     <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0001/final/images/spacer.gif>    <http://www.4at2.com/email_domains/hag/0020/final/images/footerbar.gif>  Customer Support If you have any questions relating to Customer Support, please visit our Customer Support site <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.3201.233.34125625>.  International Subscribers Please note that all special offers presented in the e-newsletter apply to the US and Canada only. If you live in Europe and would like to subscribe to our European Handspring e-newsletter, please click here <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.3202.233.34125625>.  Online Privacy Policy We encourage you to visit our website if you'd like to learn about Handspring.com's online privacy policy <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/r.jsp?rid=141.2182.10968.42943.3203.233.34125625>.  To Unsubscribe If you no longer wish to receive additional Handspring e-newsletters, please click here <http://h.4at1.com/c/e/u/unsub.jsp?uid=141.2182.10968.233.1.34125625>. <http://h.4at1.com/c/e/u/unsub.jsp?uid=141.2182.10968.233.1.34125625>      <http://r.4at1.com/c/e/r/spacer.tif?sid=141.2182.10968.233.34125625>
Subject: Save $50 on the 16MB Visor Pro handheld

Body: Any suggestions on how you want RAC to administer this policy?   -----Original Message----- From:  Bouillion, James L.   Sent: Tuesday, January 15, 2002 9:46 AM To: McMahon, Jeffrey Cc: Bradford, William S. Subject: RE: Counterparty Credit Insurance.  Jeff, please see my earlier e-mail today.  When I sent the first e-mail, we were going to own 49% of the trading Newco  I understand from the press, we will have no ownership under the UBS deal.   Therefore,  the policy will continue to protect against Counter-party defaults on those portions of the portfolio that we are retaining.  At some point we should advise insurers on the changes in ownership and the status of the portfolio as these would be "material changes " to what was originally underwritten.   Bill Bradford is wanting someone to assume responsibility for "administration and reporting" under the policy.  To whom would you want to delegate this responsibility.  Bill Bradford's group produced the required quarterly reports and Bill was working on the PG&E claim.  Please advise.    -----Original Message----- From:  McMahon, Jeffrey   Sent: Tuesday, January 15, 2002 8:11 AM To: Bouillion, James L.; Deffner, Joseph Cc: Hodge, Jeffrey T.; Bowen Jr., Raymond; Bradford, William S. Subject: RE: Counterparty Credit Insurance.  I assume this does not affect past exposures since they are not being sold.  Why are we wanting to transfer this?this seems to be UBS; problem going forward.   Jeffrey McMahon ___________________________ Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer Enron Corp 713-853-5359 phone 713-646-5930 fax jeffrey.mcmahon@enron.com   -----Original Message----- From:  Bouillion, James L.   Sent: Monday, January 14, 2002 4:04 PM To: McMahon, Jeffrey; Deffner, Joseph Cc: Hodge, Jeffrey T.; Bowen Jr., Raymond; Bradford, William S. Subject: FW: Counterparty Credit Insurance.  I received a voice mail from Bill Bradford advising that you should be made aware of this issue as it is uncertain as to where Bill will reside as a result of the sale of the trading operations.  Please provide your thoughts.   -----Original Message----- From:  Bouillion, James L.   Sent: Friday, January 11, 2002 7:49 AM To: Hodge, Jeffrey T. Cc: Bradford, William S.; Bowen Jr., Raymond Subject: Counterparty Credit Insurance.  The sale of the trading operation creates an issue with the "coverage" and  "named insured" wording on this policy, which must be addressed with the underwriters.  The change in ownership alone has a material underwriting effect which requires notice and discussion with insurers.    Enron will own only 49% of the trading going forward and the policy covers 100% of the counter-party credit exposure.  The new owner and entity are not insureds.  Would we want to approach underwriters with the request to continue the coverage for 100% and include the new owners and new entity as an insured or would we want to retain the coverage only for Enron's 49% exposure?  This is further complicated by the fact that the premium invested in the "finite layer" belongs to Enron and there are potential claims lodged against the program.  I don't have a current estimate on the PG&E exposure, however, depending on what is recovered from PG&E,  it could impact the first two layers of the insurance.  The Chubb layer (second layer) also has Directors and Officers Liability coverage included and it is exposed to current litigation. Due to the $100,000,000, aggregate in the Chubb Layer, it would provide additional coverage for both Credit and D&O going forward.  We need to meet and discuss.
Subject: FW: Counterparty Credit Insurance.

Body: You are in the New York Times today, page C6.  Can't tell if it's good or bad cuz I don't understand business jargon.  I'm about to go for a little run.  It's beautiful out.  Met a new professor today, Russian but nice.  Ready for summer vacation already!  At least we have a three day weekend.  Hope you're having a good day.  Cheers, Jules
Subject: Famous Dad

Body: *****CHASE. THE RIGHT RELATIONSHIP IS EVERYTHING. *****  Dear Valued Customer,    At Chase, we're committed to improving your online experience.   Our customers told us to make Chase Online simpler.  So we did,  and now it's easier and more convenient than ever to access  your Chase accounts and conduct transactions online.   On Saturday, January 19th, we'll be working to convert you to  the improved Chase Online. When you log on to Chase Online  after this date, you'll see new features and a new look.  Please  be assured that all of your information will automatically be  converted to the new service. There's nothing you need to do.     With the new Chase Online you will enjoy:     >One-click access to most functions    >Easier bill payments    >Quicker access to your account details  For your convenience, we have created a new "Show Me How"  tutorial to help you learn how to use most common functions,  such as paying bills or transferring money.   https://chase1.rsc01.net/servlet/cc4?JolLEAV*kpJrEINSQLgkhgEJht*z*UA   We hope you enjoy all the benefits of Chase Online.  Thank you  for banking with Chase and using Chase Online. We appreciate  your business.   Note: * Please check your ChaseMail for additional service messages    regarding this upgrade. * Any emails in your ChaseMail mailbox that have been opened    (read) and are more than 90 days old will be deleted upon    conversion.     Copyright ? 2002, J.P. Morgan Chase & Co.  All rights reserved. __________________________________________________________________________ ABOUT THIS MESSAGE: Service Related E-mail: You are receiving this message because when  you signed up for Chase Online you provided us with your e-mail  address as a method to contact you when there are service messages  regarding Chase Online.  Please be assured that we will only use your  e-mail address to send you service notices and will not send general  information about Chase's products and services unless you have  chosen this option.  This message is for information purposes only. Please do not reply to  this message, as the "reply" function is not equipped to handle  inquiries. For your convenience, you can contact Chase via e-mail by  visiting Contact Us on the Chase Home Page: https://chase1.rsc01.net/servlet/cc4?JolLEAV*kpJrEINSQLgkhgEJht*z*VA
Subject: Chase Online Upgrade - 1/19

Body: <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=he&source=16825>     <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/side.gif>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>    <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>  Enjoy your exclusive first look at our newest Twin CD Shower Companion stereo - featuring dual CD/CD-R players, digital tuner and great sound! <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/multiheader.gif>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>  Dear  Richard,   Our next catalog launches the splashproof Twin CD Shower Companion - an exciting new stereo from Sharper Image Design. It features dual vertical CD/CD-R players, an AM/FM digital PLL (Phase Lock Loop) tuner with 60 presets, a wireless remote, plus excellent sound from built-in stereo speakers.   Innovative, water-resistant housing makes this portable system ideal for enjoying music in every room in your home - even the shower! Great for all kinds of outdoor activities, too. Like our best-selling single CD Shower Companion, this new stereo offers the unique option of hanging it from a shower rod - like a regular shower radio.      <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>  <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=im&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/catalog/prodview1.jhtml?sku=SI742SIL>  New Twin CD Shower Companion with splashproof housing features dual CD/ CD-R players, digital tuner and great built-in stereo speakers!     <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/KT127EM.jpg>  Special Offer: Place any order with this email and enjoy the monthly special <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=ms&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/catalog/prodview1.jhtml?sku=KT127> - 50% off our Leather Overnighter Bag.     Having two CD players makes it easy to please the musical tastes of multiple users - or the different music desired for an energizing shower versus a relaxing bath. In addition to AM and FM, you can listen to TV broadcast audio on VHF. Other great features include ramp-up alarm clock, sleep timer, optional AC plug-in adapter and a headphone jack. We include hooks for hanging from the shower rod; a countertop stand; and a wall-mount bracket.   Click here <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=np&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/catalog/categoryview.jhtml?catid=22&pcatid=22> to get an exclusive "first look" at all the new products from the next Sharper Image catalog!   Sincerely,    <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/sig.gif> Richard Thalheimer Founder The Sharper Image <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=hp&source=16825>         <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/printcall.gif>  <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=ch&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/catalog/categoryview.jhtml?catid=22&pcatid=22>   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif>   <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=cri&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/custrewards..jhtml>  5% at Sharper Image and Galleria. Click for details <http://www.sharperimage.com/go.jhtml?tcid=42&tlid=crh&source=16825&url=http://www.sharperimage.com/us/en/custrewards.jhtml>.   <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/trans.gif> About this offer: Shop online by clicking through this email to our primary U.S. Web site, www.sharperimage.com. You may also shop by telephone (800) 344-4444 or in any of our more than 100 stores when you bring in a printout of this email. If the item is not on-hand in a store, the sales associates will be happy to place an order for you.   <http://www.virgin-atlantic.com/sharperimage>     <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/side.gif>    <http://www.sharperimagespecials.com/email/jan1402/images/auctionfoot.gif>  We hope you enjoy receiving Sharper Image's email special offers and product previews.
